intro: Erodium moschatum f. praecox, commonly known as the early scentless bedstraw, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Geraniaceae. It is a low-growing annual or biennial herb characterized by its small, fragrant flowers and finely divided leaves. The plant typically thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats, such as roadsides and fields. Its flowers are usually pink or reddish in color and bloom early in the growing season. This variety is distinguished by its earlier flowering time compared to the typical form of Erodium moschatum.
